description: Rear 2m wrap around extension and excavation of the garden
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match as closely as possible the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance .</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To safeguard the visual amenities of the wider area.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: &quot;PT Sans&quot;, sans-serif;">A scheme for the provision and
implementation of flood resilient and resistant construction details and
measures for the site against surface water flood risk shall be submitted to
and agreed in writing with the LPA in consultation with the LLFA prior to the
construction of the details and measures.&nbsp; The approved scheme shall be
carried out in its entirety before the extension is occupied and constructed
and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with current best
practices.</span><o:p></o:p></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: &quot;PT Sans&quot;, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span></p><p>



</p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-family: &quot;PT Sans&quot;, sans-serif;">REASON: To reduce the risk of surface water flooding at the site and on adjoining land given that the site is within an area known to be at high risk of surface water flooding.</span><br></p>

<p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: &quot;PT Sans&quot;, sans-serif;">Prior to superstructure works, a detailed
specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where
applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water
butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof
(substrate depth of 80-150mm, excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving
etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the
LLFA.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: &quot;PT Sans&quot;, sans-serif;">If soakaways, i.e. plastic modules and
soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure
that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration.&nbsp; It must be
demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being
discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
